title: Louise Redknapp cuts a chic figure in black trouser suit as she leaves It Takes Two
text:
Earlier in the day she spoke candidly about the breakdown of her marriage to Jamie Redknapp.

And Louise Redknapp was spotted leaving the Strictly It Takes Two studios in London on Friday, hours after her interview.

The former Eternal singer, 44, looked chic in a sharply tailored trouser suit paired with heels as she stepped out.

Style: Louise Redknapp was spotted leaving the Strictly It Takes Two studios in London on Friday, hours after her interview

She slipped on a black top which emphasised her toned waist, teamed with a black satin panelled blazer.

The star donned a pair of black culottes, with the outfit completed with black stiletto heels.

Her caramel locks were styled in loose waves swept into a ponytail while her pretty features were enhanced with a radiant palette of make-up.

Style: The former Eternal singer, 44, looked chic in a sharply tailored trouser suit paired with heels as she stepped out

Smile: Her caramel locks were styled in loose waves swept into a ponytail while her pretty features were enhanced with a radiant palette of make-up

Looking good: The star looked effortlessly chic in her work attire at the show

The outing comes as Louise insisted she still 'doesn't know' why her marriage to Jamie broke down after 19 years together.

The singer said on Friday's This Morning that despite rumours, she 'doesn't blame' her stint on Strictly Come Dancing for the breakdown of her marriage, as she and Jamie split in late 2017, a year after she appeared on the show.

Louise also told Richard Madeley and Judy Finnigan that it took her a 'long time' to get over the split thanks to large amount of people involved, but she's moving forward now as she plots her musical comeback.

Candid:The outing comes as Louise insisted she still 'doesn't know' why her marriage to Jamie broke down after 19 years together

Louise candidly spoke about the end of her marriage as she chatted to Richard and Judy about her long-awaited musical comeback.

When asked directly what went wrong between her and Jamie, she said: 'I wish I knew, it was really sad and sad times for the whole family. It's something that takes a long time to get over.'

Just a year before she and Jamie split, Louise was a contestant on Strictly in 2016, and during the stint rumours were rife about the show's famous curse.

Sad: Louise divorced husband Jamie in late 2017 after 19 years of marriage. The couple are parents to sons Charles, 15, and Beau, ten (pictured in 2016)

Open: The singer said on Friday's This Morning that she 'doesn't blame' her stint on Strictly Come Dancing for the end of her marriage, despite rumours about the show's 'curse'

But Louise said that actually taking part in the show actually proved that she can't blame anyone for the end of her marriage.

She said: 'It reminded me that this was no one's fault, and not Jamie's, things go on far deeper than a TV programme.

'What the programme did for me just reminded me how much I loved performing. My kids see that now they come to their gigs and say ''do you know what mum it's been a tough time but it's really lovely to see you singing along in a car. '

'Times like that I get asked all the time about it, but when there's a whole family involved it's massive in everybody's life.'

Speaking out: When asked what went wrong, Louise said: 'I wish I knew, it was really sad and sad times for the whole family. It's something that takes a long time to get over'

Louise also spoke to Richard and Judy about her comeback to music, which comes with the release of her new album Heavy Love in early 2020.

When asked whether her new album has any reference to the end of her marriage, she said: 'I never went into making the album with it being about that because you don't, but when you're in the studio naturally you pull your heart out.

'There are songs on the album that are never bashing, it was just how I felt as a mother as a wife. This whole album, all you can do is put on what you've been through.'

The music marks Louise's first new release in 18 years, and she admitted there's no exact reason why she took such a long break from the industry.

Truth: She said: 'It reminded me that this was no one's fault, and not Jamie's, things go on far deeper than a TV programme'

Glamorous: Louise was a guest on This Morning to chat about her long-awaited musical comeback, which comes with her new album set for release in early 2020

She told Richard and Judy: 'I think it was just life, life got in the way I got married and had a family and as time goes on the industry changes so much, you need something to happen for there to be a reason.

'It wasn't meant to be 18 years it just happened. I did Strictly and wanted to get back out there working, and someone in management said: ''Do you fancy doing a one-off gig.''

'I was really scared it had been a long time. I spent a long time making an album, then we sat down and looked at all the music they said you really need to do an album.'

Before the interview viewers also enjoyed a throwback clip of Louise from her days in the girl band Eternal, and the star said that she still looks back fondly on her days with the group.

'They were great times being part of Eternal I'm so proud because those record sales just don't happen today, being an artist now so much has changed in my life,' she said.
